intro: Dichaeta uliginosa, commonly known as the bog thistle, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It typically grows in marshy areas and is characterized by its tall, unbranched stem and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered flowers in the summer. Dichaeta uliginosa plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in moist environments.
